perturbation.original_text: The undersigned hereby agree to jointly prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and any future amendments thereto reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, and hereby affirm that such Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D is being filed on behalf of each of the undersigned pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned agree to prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and future filings reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but this does not represent a joint filing agreement unless all parties explicitly confirm their agreement in writing within 5 business days of each filing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes a clear joint filing agreement. The modified text introduces uncertainty by stating that the agreement is not joint unless confirmed within 5 business days. This creates an in-text contradiction because the initial statement of agreement is undermined by the conditional clause, conflicting with the purpose of the initial sentence and the entire agreements purpose.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The undersigned agree to prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and future filings reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but this does not represent a joint filing agreement unless all parties explicitly confirm their agreement in writing within 5 business days of each filing. The undersigned acknowledge that each shall be responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, and for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning her or it contained therein, but shall not be responsible for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning the other, except to the extent that she or it knows or has reason to believe that such information is inaccurate. Dated: March 27, 2020. /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield BUTTERFIELD FAMILY TRUST By: /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield Co-Trustee 1

perturbation.original_text: The undersigned acknowledge that each shall be responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, and for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning her or it contained therein, but shall not be responsible for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning the other, except to the extent that she or it knows or has reason to believe that such information is inaccurate.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned acknowledge that each entity is generally responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, but no entity will be held liable for errors or omissions of other entities unless there is evidence of direct involvement in or knowledge of the inaccuracy.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies responsibility for timely filing and accurate information. The modified text attempts to soften this responsibility by stating that no entity will be held liable unless direct involvement or knowledge of inaccuracy can be proved. This adds an ambiguity regarding the level of due diligence expected of each party. If 'direct involvement' is difficult to prove, it contradicts the initial intention of ensuring each party's accountability in the original text.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The undersigned agree to prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and future filings reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but this does not represent a joint filing agreement unless all parties explicitly confirm their agreement in writing within 5 business days of each filing. The undersigned acknowledge that each entity is generally responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, but no entity will be held liable for errors or omissions of other entities unless there is evidence of direct involvement in or knowledge of the inaccuracy. Dated: March 27, 2020. /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield BUTTERFIELD FAMILY TRUST By: /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield Co-Trustee 1

perturbation.changed_text: Dated: March 27, 2020. This agreement shall automatically terminate on March 27, 2021, unless all parties actively agree to renew for an additional year. Renewal must be confirmed in writing no later than February 27, 2021.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement simply states the date of the agreement. The new clause introduces an automatic termination date. The introduction of a termination clause is a contradiction in terms with the indefinite nature of the original text and intent, especially in the absence of any mention of a termination clause in the original text.
perturbation.contradicted_text: The undersigned agree to prepare and file with the applicable regulatory authorities this Schedule 13G or Schedule 13D and future filings reporting each of the undersigned's ownership of securities of the issuer named herein, but this does not represent a joint filing agreement unless all parties explicitly confirm their agreement in writing within 5 business days of each filing. The undersigned acknowledge that each entity is generally responsible for the timely filing of such amendments, but no entity will be held liable for errors or omissions of other entities unless there is evidence of direct involvement in or knowledge of the inaccuracy. Dated: March 27, 2020. This agreement shall automatically terminate on March 27, 2021, unless all parties actively agree to renew for an additional year. Renewal must be confirmed in writing no later than February 27, 2021. /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield BUTTERFIELD FAMILY TRUST By: /s/ Shelby J. Butterfield Shelby J. Butterfield Co-Trustee 1
